entities: Security Council Working Group on Peacekeeping Operations
reporting_cycle: The Secretary-General reports to the Council on individual peacekeeping operations; assessments meetings with interested delegations, in particular troop-contributing countries, at appropriate stages of each peacekeeping operation
summary:
The Security Council supports meetings between the Secretariat and troop-contributing countries, with participation of Special Representatives, Force Commanders, and Civilian Police Commissioners, where appropriate.

The forms of consultations mentioned are not exhaustive, and other forms may include formal or informal communication between the President or members of the Council, the Secretary-General, and troop-contributing countries, as well as other affected countries.
